meanings.definition: To strike with an open hand
meanings.sent1: She will slap the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: He likes to slap his friend playfully on the back.
meanings.sent3: The chef will slap the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The wind will slap the flag against the pole.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will slap the ruler on the desk to quiet the class.

meanings.definition: A sharp blow with the hand or an object
meanings.sent1: The slap on his shoulder was a friendly gesture.
meanings.sent2: The loud slap of the door closing startled her.
meanings.sent3: The clown's slapstick routine always makes me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The slap of the waves against the shore was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The slap of the ball hitting the wall echoed in the gym.

meanings.definition: A sound made by a sharp blow
meanings.sent1: The slap of the book hitting the floor was loud.
meanings.sent2: The slap of the ruler on the desk made everyone jump.
meanings.sent3: The slap of the rain on the window was calming.
meanings.sent4: The slap of the hammer on the nail echoed in the room.
meanings.sent5: The slap of the hand on the table silenced the room.

meanings.definition: To put or place something quickly and forcefully
meanings.sent1: She will slap the papers on the desk before leaving.
meanings.sent2: He tends to slap his keys on the table when he comes home.
meanings.sent3: The chef will slap the ingredients into the pot for the stew.
meanings.sent4: The wind will slap the leaves against the window.
meanings.sent5: The worker will slap the paint on the wall for a quick finish.
